Key Match Events: The Dodgers mounted a title-winning comeback after falling behind the Yankees by five runs in the first three innings
The Dodgers scored five times in a fifth-inning rally fueled by shockingly poor Yankees defense and clutch hits from Freddie Freeman and Teoscar Hernández
The final six outs were stressful, with Blake Treinen taking care of the eighth, and — in another unthinkable turn — starting pitcher Walker Buehler emerging for the save in the ninth
Post-Match Reflections: Freddie Freeman was the World Series MVP
Mookie Betts drove in the go-ahead run Wednesday with the second of the eighth-inning sac flies
Manager Dave Roberts said, ‘I wanted this one.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers had aimed for more than just regular-season success. More than just repeated trips to the postseason. More than just a lone, COVID-bubble championship in a pandemic-shortened 2020 season. This, as president of baseball operations Andrew Friedman had declared time and again, was supposed to be a ‘golden era of Dodgers baseball’, a generation of organizational excellence unmatched in the storied, but often tortured, history of the century-old franchise.
Others: The Dodgers beat the Yankees to win another World Series, cementing ‘golden era’ of franchise dominance
The final out of the Dodgers’ Game 5 win over the New York Yankees to clinch the World Series title Wednesday night at Yankee Stadium.
